intro: Diapedium assurgens, commonly known as the climbing diapedium, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its vining growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically followed by orange to red fruits. It is native to parts of South America and thrives in warm, tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
